Classical.Structure: The Enteric Nervous System (ENS), or 'Second Brain'. A vast, independent mesh-like network of over 100 million neurons embedded in the wall of the gastrointestinal (GI) tract.
Classical.Function: Manages GI tract motility, secretion, and blood flow *independently* of the CNS. Communicates extensively with the CNS via the Vagus Nerve (D3.VagusNerve).
Classical.Pathology: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), gastroparesis, links to Parkinson's.

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: Hosts a complex microbiome (D4.Microbiome) whose collective quantum state may influence the L1 substrate of the ENS. (Ref: Paper 1, Ch. 23)
SCPN.L2_NeurochemicalNeurological: A 'Second L2 Brain'. The ENS produces ~90% of the body's serotonin and ~50% of its dopamine. It runs its own complex L2 computations and sends the *results* to the D4.CNS via the D3.VagusNerve. (Ref: Paper 2)
SCPN.L4_CellularTissueSynchronisation: Generates its own 'slow wave' L4 oscillations (e.g., the 'migrating motor complex') that govern gut motility. (Ref: Paper 4)
SCPN.L5_OrganismalPsychoemotional: A primary 'L5 Qualia Generator'. This is the source of the 'gut-feeling' (Ref: Paper 5). It generates a complex 'Geometric Qualia' shape representing the holistic state of the gut/microbiome, which is transmitted to the D3.Insula as a core part of the 'felt-sense'.

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'Cauldron' or 'Gut Instinct'. The seat of somatic, non-rational intelligence and intuition.

Falsification_Hypotheses: H1 (L5 Generation): A 'gut-in-a-dish' (in-vitro ENS) preparation is given an L2 stimulus (e.g., capsaicin). It will *fail* to produce a coherent, complex L4/L5 electrical/chemical oscillation pattern (the 'Geometric Qualia' signal). This would falsify its role as the 'generator' (vs. just a simple L2 relay).

H2 (L5 vs L2): A D3.VagusNerve-severed subject is given a gut stimulus (e.g., L2 serotonin precursor). The subject will report *no L5 qualia* (no 'gut feeling'), *but* L2 hormonal blood markers for serotonin will rise. This dissociates the L5 'Geometric Qualia' (a vagal signal) from the L2 'hormonal' (a circulatory signal) pathways.

H3 (vs Insula): A subject with a lesioned D3.Brain.Insula (no L5 'felt-sense') will *still* show a coherent L4/L5 signal generated in the ENS (via electrogastrogram, EGG) *and* transmitted up the D3.VagusNerve. This dissociates the 'Generator' (ENS) from the 'Integrator' (Insula).
Experimental_Protocols: Ref: Paper 17, Protocol 18.A (In-Vitro ENS Qualia Generation)
Ref: Paper 17, Protocol 17.C (Vagotomy L2/L5 Dissociation fMRI)

KeyEquations_LaTeX: L4 Slow Wave (Oscillator): H_{\text{slow_wave}} = \sum_i \hbar\omega_i a_i^\dagger a_i + \sum_{ij} g_{ij} (a_i^\dagger a_j + h.c.)
